author: kian sie
comment: I like the app so far, but I have encountered a glitch which causes a second layer of the icons to appear in the main menu. This causes the two layers to overlap, decreasing visibility. I hope a fix for this comes out soon. I would also like it if I could select from playlists, as it gives a lot more choice for the user. I look forward to seeing any improvements you might bring to the app from now on.

reply.author: Pawel Dyjak
reply.content:
Hello!
If you can reach me through Google Play "Send email" option and describe some reproduction steps, I would be grateful. I've encountered the issue myself few times but I'm not able to reproduce it anymore, so it makes it pretty hard to fix.

author: Sidhant Padhi
comment: This app helped me browse around my library without always opening the phone which is really good. I have given it 4 stars as the first look and use was superb..... With further evaluation I might increase or decrease the number of stars but the previous reviews are also all promising

author: Henry Hilliard
comment: Hey, great work. This is a great app; very useful for picking artists/albums/songs from my vast music library. Opens up a whole new use for my watch. So far I have not ran into any bugs. Very handy.  I own an LG Watch Style with a crown scroller. My only complaint (and the reason I give it 4 stars) is that the crown whirly doesn't scroll through the library lists as I feel it should, since it would match the rest of the watch UI. I know this probably isn't a bug, just something that hasn't been implemented yet. Overall a great app though, it's at the top of my favorite apps on my watch! EDIT: After using this app for a while, I've noticed that the scrolling wheel functionality works when you first open the app on the watch if the app was last open on a library list. The scroll wheel ability stops working as soon as you change lists, such as tapping an artist you want to hear. Hope you can fix this!

author: Joseph McCartin
comment: App looks great, but it doesn't appear to work at all on my wear 2.0 device - there is no service running and I just have the standard music controls. Will change my review if an update fixes this. EDIT: Looks like apps have to be installed via Google play on the watch first (and not just on the phone). Have amended score.

author: Alexander Osler
comment: Really nice app, only issue was that the time display is cut off on my lg watch style, so I can just see the tops of the clock's numbers but I can't tell what they are. Not a total deal breaker but still quite annoying

author: The True Saxon
comment: Fantastic app, my wearable would allow (once started Poweramp) pause, rwd, ffwd, volume BUT once stopped app couldn't simply restart via wearable unless opening app in phone, with this app I no longer have this issue! Additionally with all the options to access areas of Poweramp too makes this great!

author: Erik nV shield LTE
comment: It's decent three star app as other say, allows you to change folders without looking at the phone. Not that bluetooth connected headset or speakers aren't capable of the same, here you can see and navigate with ease and comfort of not getting to any device or remotes, only with the exception of Bluetooth headset. My most hoped function is missing however and would like to know if FAST FORWARD will be added in the future? I tried to hold the skip for over few seconds to no avail :( really sad because Power Amp is a perfect package from back in the days when it was only one of very few apps with built in graphic equalizer and now with wear, I do not regret I picked this over the other apps. Outperformed and outlived the ugly other ones, plus great constant support and improvements. Zenwatch 2 AW v1.5

author: Kyle Quarles
comment: It's a shame the album browser is so different from how poweramp's normally functions - I'd really like the option to either group by album artist (instead of having a separate album entry for every single track artist that appears therein - VERY frustrating on albums with many different artists contributing to it!) and that generally all the caching and connecting is a little slow and flaky. Might need to exclude the service from some of the more aggressive battery saving I do on my phone, so I won't detract any stars for that! Still, the album list behavior is a definite spot for improvement.  Would love to contribute to this project if it's open sourced! I don't like to blindly ramble on about changes I'd like to see without attempting to contribute somehow. :)

author: Katie Price
comment: App keeps crashing on my Moto 360 and then the app is removed from the watch.

author: Mihai-Daniel Muresan
comment: not working on huawei watch w1 and huawei p10

author: Baharul Islam
comment: ThnX super aap

author: Thomas Guppy
comment: Would be great if the folder view was collapsible.

author: Nicholas Haraczy
comment: Perfect. Thanks Pawel!

author: Sasuke Rawat
comment: Perfecr

author: Tom Kroes
comment: EDIT: apparently just unaware of how Wear 2.0 works. The app works like a charm

author: Supratim Samanta
comment: 4 stars for now.   Like the app so far. Just installed a day ago. I will see the battery consumption and the give my final verdict.  Request to developer:  Can you add the playlists.

reply.author: Pawel Dyjak
reply.content: Thanks! I'll look into playlists feature soon :)

author: Maxx Jaeger
comment: Very useful app! There however IS an option in poweramp (at least in the alpha build) called "Always Process Album Art" where it always broadcasts the album art even with the screen off.

reply.author: Pawel Dyjak
reply.content:
Wow, didn't know that! Thanks. I'll investigate this and release a proper fix soon :)

Edit: the function you've mentioned is available only in alpha build.

author: Daniel Dennison
comment: Review for previous version:   Using this app on my watch turns on my phone's screen when I open it or use it.  That's the only issue. I would like a volume control to be added. Otherwise it's a great app.  Fix the "phone screen on when watch app is used" issue and add a volume control and I'll be happy to donate and even share the app on my YouTube channel...  Added note: June 13, 2017   Thank you so much for adding the volume controls in the last update. I love this app 100% now.  YouTube showcase time. 🤣! Thanks so much.

reply.author: Pawel Dyjak
reply.content: Hi! Thanks for the feedback. Yes, screen is turned on for a second when changing song - that's because of the bug in Poweramp music player itself - it refreshes album art only after turning on the screen. There's not much I can do about it - without this hack album art wouldn't refresh on your watch. Regarding volume control - wait for update :)

author: Corvida Raven
comment: Love this app! Long time Poweramp user and this is the perfect companion app for Android wear. My only request would be an option to see album art by itself when playing music. Currently using Music Boss to achieve this, but adding this view would eliminate the need for two apps.

author: Horiuchi Bonsai
comment: I like where this app is going but the developer needs to fix a few things before it's amazing. Everytime I changed a song the device that I'm connected to would turn on. When pressing buttons there is no way to tell if your pressing it.

reply.author: Pawel Dyjak
reply.content:
Hello,
I really encourage you to try the new updated version of application. All issues that you've mentioned have been already addressed :)

author: Arsalan mapar
comment: Useful
